item.title: Headaches at a high level
item.description: In my recent work, I’ve been pondering how to best approach “high-level” project estimates, especially when they’re crucial for a client’s budget planning. While a “ballpark” figure is implied, the need for realism remains essential. One challenge I face is finding the right balance between being overly prepared and providing a rough estimate. When a project is done, how much variance is acceptable from that initial high-level estimate? Is it 10%, 25%, or even 50%?
